subhead: After a false start due to a procedural error, the cement manufacturer's trial finally began on Tuesday. On Wednesday, its former CEO was questioned about why the group chose to remain in Syria despite the civil war.

title: COP30 overshadowed by trade tensions: 'How to collaborate on decarbonization while protecting economic interests'
subhead: The issue of international trade has taken on unprecedented importance in the global climate negotiations currently underway in Brazil. Disagreements center on the European carbon border adjustment mechanism.

subhead: Eugène Green's fable, led by Portuguese stars Ana Moreira and Diogo Doria, playfully probes the contradictions of modern times.

title: 'The Nuremberg trials mark a seminal moment that put an end to the impunity of heads of state'
subhead: On November 20, 1945, in the southern German city of Nuremberg, a historic trial began for around 20 top Nazi officials. Historian Sylvie Lindeperg recalls how the event became a major milestone for international justice.

byline: Marie Jo Sader and  Noé Hochet-Bodin

title: COP30 presents an existential issue for Indigenous peoples
subhead: The global climate conference was meant to be a moment of recognition for Indigenous peoples, who have been placed at the heart of President Lula's political agenda. Yet, faced with the Brazilian president's contradictions, Indigenous activists have come to the fore, determined to make their voices heard at a summit that directly affects them.

title: 'We're all afraid': Marseille community buries anti-drug activist's murdered brother
subhead: The burial of Mehdi Kessaci took place on Tuesday, under heavy police protection. While displaying a spirit of resistance, those who dared to condemn drug trafficking admitted to being paralyzed by this killing.
